reviews.review:
A worthwhile expansion to the universe of Half-Life 1.

The game shows its age. It's not fond of alt-tabbing... Or loading with a gun out... Or jumping on barrels...

BUT, it is still very playable, and very interesting. And, moreover, it evokes a lot of powerful feelings in the playing. I felt genuinely nervous and on-edge traipsing through the halls of Black Mesa once again. Not having the luxury of HEV, though dropped armor makes up the difference... But that dropped armor can't be relied upon in the same way that HEV felt in the original Half-Life.

And a trip into Xen before the end of the game? Pretty exciting.

Just as well, we get a further look into the life and struggles of one Barney Calhoun before the events of Half-Life 2. Which is nice. I'd been sitting on these titles for a very long time, and I'm glad I've finally started to play them.

Likely worth their full price. But definitely worth the pennies paid on Valve holiday sale.

well this has been a disappointment.
after playing the original half life and opposing force i was expecting another good expansion pack, but this was nothing compared to them, it was short and full of bugs.

characters wouldn't have dialogue when i reloaded a quick save, Dr Rosenburg would barely walk a step before stopping and needing a break, and once he just full on stopped, sometimes i couldn't move when i went back to fix it.

it adds barely any content other than a new character and some new parts of black mesa, and even those are bland in themselves.

it had some annoying puzzles near the end of the game and was much shorter than Opposing Forces.

the good parts  were the start and the last endgame part, and of course the credits, because i didn't need to play the game anymore

For this review I'd like to pretend that it's 2001 and the game just released this year. By the time this game came out, the gold source engine was already pretty outdated, but this is just a mod for Half-Life 1 so it doesn't really deserve it's own engine.

A nice short Half-Life game to play in an afternoon. 85/100.

The game was overall decent, but not as good in comparison to other half lives. I played this on easiest difficulty so probably why I didn't enjoy it as much. I think the points which dragged it down were having that scientist to follow you where he ran back all the way to the start at one point... having someone to follow you is really annoying and I disliked how Half Life 2 did as such. There weren't many new models and code behind them which is fine, but it's always nice to see something new regardless of story. I also thought the scenes in which how you escaped the underground of Black Mesa was far too short. You reach the surface in minutes and it destroys your immersion of being in this big cavern-like research facility. Other than that... Held its weight in 2020 I feel like.

Half Life serisini bitirin ama bu ve Opposing Force pek sarmıyor illa her şeyini oynayacağım diye kafaya taktıysanız oynayın ama oynamazsanız da bir şey kaçırmazsınız.

Выставил FullHD - и всё сломалось подчистую.

"Have a good one, Calhoun." - Anonymous Black Mesa security guard
And it is indeed good. Blue Shift, Barney Calhoun's expansion to the original Half-Life, is shorter than Opposing Force, has no new weapons, but has the advantage of allowing you to play as the famous security guard who goes on to play a main role in the Half-Life series. Barney's adventure through the Black Mesa Research Facility is completely recommended to anyone who enjoys first person shooters.
Another amazing, but short, expansion.

Blue shift is the first Half-Life game I actually beat when I was younger. It poses far less of a challenge than the OG and Opposing force and it's overall a much calmer experience. That being said, it does have it's own challenges and a story that is worth playing if your a fan of the Half-Life series.

I will say that this version is fairly buggy and tends to close out randomly so save often.

Half-Life devamı niteliğinde değil, bağımsız ek bir mod olarak da düşünmeyin. Gordon Freeman ile eş zamanlı ilerlediğiniz bir hikaye. O sebep ile oyunun içine oyuncuyu çekiyor. Gordon Freeman gözünden değil de onu dünya gözü ile görmek güzel...

And I was told add-ons aren't worth to be played!…

Actually this made me feel, alive? again. With all those near-death situations, lack of bullets, I realized I am just a human and not a terminator, like I for some reason feel when I play half-life. And humans, beside running and gunning, have to gather information and use their mind! It is the most noticeable on Hard difficulty.

Also! Puzzles! With the barrel one, I was thinking to the end that it won't work, while it actually worked as I thought :D Incredible!

All those scripts really made me feel like I am there. How the guard at the start was washing their hands, then drying with an air dryer, why don't people make all that in newer games?…

To conclude — absolutely amazing!^^ WORTH PLAYING!!

…well now that I recall maybe death scenes are a bit too tragic, at least for me .-.

Somehow it manages to be more halflife and less halflife at the same time.

I'm not going to recommend this game.

[list]
[*] It is very short (a little bit more than 3 hours long)
[*] It has no new weapons
[*] It has no new monsters or bosses
[*] It has a couple of very stupid puzzles at the end.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2164783736
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2164781896
[*] It feels like a very good mod but does not feel like a stand-alone game.
[*] Currently, it is sold at the same price as "Opposing Force", which is superior in any way.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/50/HalfLife_Opposing_Force/
[/list]

If you want to know how Barney escaped Black Mesa - buy it.
If you don't care - skip it.

Short trip through Black Mesa Incident from the perspective of Barney Calhoun. 
It is really short - smth about 3 hours. 

A little buggy: reloading animation sometimes doesn't work, models are unstable in moving surroundings, sometimes on quick load your gun starts shooting non-stop.

Still worth playing!

Half-Life: Blue Shift is...fine. It's short (2-3 hours max), sweet, and a little bit more half-life. 

Because you aren't playing as the great and terrible FREEMAN, Barry gets by with far more traditional armor pick-ups scattered throughout. The arsenal is identical but unlike the first game doesn't feel as well utilized. The level design is decent enough, fairly straightforward save for one or two environmental puzzles near the end that come off as poorly communicated to the player (hint: barrels can somehow connect detonation fuses), but elsewise this is a fairly streamlined, condensed greatest hits collection that is lesser than the sum of its parts, but is still an overall enjoyable experience.  Even after playing through twice on normal and hard, I found very little memorable, save for the comically bizarre deaths of all the other Barry Calhouns in the game. Unless like me you're looking to see everything the half-life brand has to offer, this one is skippable, but I can't not recommend it on the grounds that it's still fun! Just nothing to write home about.
Keine Revolution aber eine paar Stunden spannende Unterhaltung. Schönes Spiel.

Дополнение, абсолютно противоположное Opposing Force, полное отсутствие новых идей, те же самые виды оружия, те же самые противники и только бывшие уже в оригинале игровые механики. Прибавим сюда скудную продолжительность (я лично прошёл за 3 часа 10 минут) и возникает вопрос - а нужно ли вообще было создавать данное дополнение?
Моё мнение - да! Всё дело в том, что это дополнение, несмотря на отсутствие каких-либо самобытных идей отлично справляется со своей основной задачей, а именно - развивает и наполняет деталями историю оригинальной игры.
Правда уточню, что один крупный минус я всё же нашёл, в игре приличное количество "интуитивно-НЕпонятных моментов", когда непонятно что делать или банально куда идти. Пару раз приходилось даже гуглить прохождение, но это уже мелочи.
